title: Kingswinford Railway Walk Route

images.title: Roger  Kidd / Kingswinford Railway Walk, West Midlands
images.caption: Kingswinford Railway Walk, West Midlands. The railway was finally closed in 1965 , having only served passengers for seven years from 1925 to 1932.

images.title: John M / Kingswinford Railway Walk
images.caption: Section of the disused track north of Wombourne Station.

images.title: Roger  Kidd / Himley Station, Staffordshire
images.caption: Himley Station, Staffordshire With astonishing optimism, the Great Western Railway opened this station in 1925 with a platform more than 140 metres in length! Passengers used the line for just seven years. Now it part of the South Staffordshire Railway Walk

images.title: South Staffordshire Railway Walk at Wombourne by Roger  Kidd, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: South Staffordshire Railway Walk at Wombourne

images.title: Roger  Kidd / South Staffordshire Railway Walk at Himley
images.caption: South Staffordshire Railway Walk at Himley

description: A circular walk from Kingswinford along a disused railway track, visiting Wombourne and the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal . The walk starts just to the north of the town where you can pick up the South Staffordshire Railway Walk . This shared cycling and walking trail follows the trackbed of the old Wolverhampton to Dudley railway line. Follow the flat path west and it will take you to Himley and the woodland of the Himley Plantation. The trail then heads through Wombourne where this route leaves the rail trail to cross Bratch Bridge. You can continue all the way along the rail trail to Wolverhampton though if you wish. This route heads to the impressive Bratch Locks on the canal. Here you can pick up the towpath and follow it south to Swindon. You then leave the canal to head back to Himley where you can pick up the South Staffordshire Railway Walk and return to the start point near Kingswinford.
